title: balanced?
description: Write a function `balanced?` that takes a binary search tree and returns true if the tree is balanced (the height difference between left and right subtrees of any node is at most 1), and false otherwise.

examples.explanation: A single node tree is balanced
Tree is balanced since height difference is 1
Tree is not balanced due to height difference of 2

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (balanced? t))

(balanced? empty)
(balanced? (make-node empty empty 5))
(balanced? (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
(balanced? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 2) empty 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (balanced? (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) true)
(check-expect (balanced? (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) false)
(check-expect (balanced? (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) empty 10)) false)
(check-expect (balanced? (make-node empty (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15)) false)
